info.official_title: A Phase III Randomized Study of BL-B01D1 in Combination With Osimertinib Versus Osimertinib as First-Line Treatment in Patients With EGFR-Mutated Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

identified_line.line: 1. Sign the informed consent form voluntarily and follow the protocol requirements;

criterions.exact_snippets: Sign the informed consent form voluntarily

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Sign the informed consent form voluntarily
follow the protocol requirements

identified_line.line: 2. Age ≥18 years old;

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Age ≥18 years old

identified_line.line: 3. Expected survival time ≥3 months;

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Expected survival time ≥3 months

identified_line.line: 4. Patients with unresectable or radical radiotherapy for locally advanced non-small cell lung cancer;

criterions.exact_snippets: locally advanced non-small cell lung cancer
locally advanced non-small cell lung cancer

locally advanced non-small cell lung cancer
locally advanced non-small cell lung cancer
radical radiotherapy
locally advanced non-small cell lung cancer
locally advanced non-small cell lung cancer

identified_line.line: 5. Documentation of EGFR sensitive mutations detected from tumor tissue or blood samples;

criterions.exact_snippets: EGFR sensitive mutations detected from tumor tissue or blood samples

or_criteria.exact_snippets: EGFR sensitive mutations detected from tumor tissue or blood samples

identified_line.line: 6. Consent to provide archived tumor tissue samples or fresh tissue samples of primary or metastatic lesions at or after diagnosis for testing, including EGFR mutation type;

criterions.exact_snippets: Consent to provide archived tumor tissue samples or fresh tissue samples

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Consent to provide archived tumor tissue samples or fresh tissue samples
EGFR mutation type

identified_line.line: 7. At least one measurable lesion meeting the RECIST v1.1 definition was required;

At least one measurable lesion meeting the RECIST v1.1 definition

identified_line.line: 10. No severe cardiac dysfunction, left ventricular ejection fraction ≥50%;

and_criteria.exact_snippets: No severe cardiac dysfunction
left ventricular ejection fraction ≥50%

identified_line.line: 13. For premenopausal women of childbearing potential, a pregnancy test must be performed within 7 days before the initiation of treatment, serum pregnancy must be negative, and the patient must not be lactating; All enrolled patients (male or female) were advised to use adequate barrier contraception throughout the treatment cycle and for 6 months after the end of treatment.

the patient must not be lactating
All enrolled patients (male or female) were advised to use adequate barrier contraception throughout the treatment cycle and for 6 months after the end of treatment

identified_line.line: Healthy volunteers allowed

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Healthy volunteers allowed

identified_line.line: Must have minimum age of 18 Years

and_criteria.exact_snippets: minimum age of 18 Years

identified_line.line: 1. Previous histologic or cytological evidence of small cell or mixed small/non-small cell components;

criterions.exact_snippets: Previous histologic or cytological evidence of small cell or mixed small/non-small cell components
criterions.criterion: small cell or mixed small/non-small cell components

not_criteria.criterion: small cell or mixed small/non-small cell components

identified_line.line: 2. Patients with previous systemic therapy;
3. Patients had received EGFR-TKI therapy;

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Patients had received EGFR-TKI therapy

identified_line.line: 4. Studies received radical radiotherapy, major surgery, and large area radiotherapy within 4 weeks before randomization;

criterions.exact_snippets: received radical radiotherapy ... within 4 weeks before randomization
received ... major surgery ... within 4 weeks before randomization
received ... large area radiotherapy within 4 weeks before randomization

and_criteria.exact_snippets: received radical radiotherapy ... within 4 weeks before randomization
received ... major surgery ... within 4 weeks before randomization
received ... large area radiotherapy within 4 weeks before randomization

identified_line.line: 5. History of severe heart disease and cerebrovascular disease;

and_criteria.exact_snippets: History of severe heart disease
History of severe heart disease
History of ... cerebrovascular disease

identified_line.line: 6. Unstable thrombotic events requiring therapeutic intervention within 6 months before screening; Infusion-related thrombosis was excluded;

criterions.exact_snippets: Unstable thrombotic events requiring therapeutic intervention within 6 months before screening
Unstable thrombotic events requiring therapeutic intervention within 6 months before screening

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Unstable thrombotic events requiring therapeutic intervention within 6 months before screening
Unstable thrombotic events requiring therapeutic intervention within 6 months before screening

identified_line.line: 7. QT prolongation, complete left bundle branch block, III degree atrioventricular block, frequent and uncontrollable arrhythmia;

and_criteria.exact_snippets: frequent and uncontrollable arrhythmia
frequent and uncontrollable arrhythmia

identified_line.line: 8. Were diagnosed with active malignancy within 3 years before randomization;

criterions.exact_snippets: diagnosed with active malignancy within 3 years before randomization

not_criteria.exact_snippets: diagnosed with active malignancy within 3 years before randomization

identified_line.line: 10. Patients with poor glycemic control;
11. A history of ILD requiring steroid therapy, or current ILD or grade ≥2 radiation pneumonitis, or a suspicion of such disease;

criterions.exact_snippets: A history of ILD requiring steroid therapy

criterions.criterion: suspicion of ILD or radiation pneumonitis

and_criteria.exact_snippets: A history of ILD requiring steroid therapy
current ILD

or_criteria.criterion: suspicion of ILD or radiation pneumonitis

identified_line.line: 12. Complicated with pulmonary diseases leading to clinically severe respiratory function impairment;

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Complicated with pulmonary diseases
clinically severe respiratory function impairment

identified_line.line: 13. Patients with active central nervous system metastasis;
16. Imaging examination showed that the tumor had invaded or enveloped the large blood vessels in the abdomen, chest, neck, and pharynx;

identified_line.line: 19. Patients with a history of inflammatory bowel disease, extensive bowel resection, immune enteritis, intestinal obstruction or chronic diarrhea;
20. Patients with a history of allergy to recombinant humanized antibodies or to any of the excipients of BL-B01D1;

identified_line.line: 21. Had autologous or allogeneic stem cell transplantation history;

and_criteria.exact_snippets: autologous or allogeneic stem cell transplantation history

identified_line.line: 22. Human immunodeficiency virus antibody positive, active hepatitis B virus infection or hepatitis C virus infection;
23. A history of severe neurological or psychiatric illness;

identified_line.line: 9. Hypertension poorly controlled by two antihypertensive drugs (systolic blood pressure > 150 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure > 100 mmHg);

identified_line.line: 8. ECOG 0 or 1;
9. The toxicity of previous antineoplastic therapy has returned to ≤ grade 1 as defined by NCI-CTCAE v5.0;
